. Uummannaq is a town of about 1,300 people with another 1,300 residing in the surrounding settlements. The main industry in the area is fishing for halibut, which has recently overtaken hunting as the principal industry for the town. The town is about 500 km north of the Arctic Circle, and the midnight sun is experienced from mid-May through August.

Uummannaq is on a heartshaped island, hence its name,
. From there a helicopter will take you to the heliport in Uummannaq. The easiest way to get to Uummannaq is to take a flight from
. Then take the 10-minute helicopter flight to Uummannaq, in the winter the journey from
is easy by car, but by air is faster.

The city can be traversed on foot. The surrounding region can in the summer be visited by boat, and in winter by dogsled or snowmobile. Dog sleds are used during the winter months to travel around the city, to fishing sites, and to the nearby settlements.

Whale safaris are available in Uummannaq from July through the fall. The fjord that surrounds Uummannaq is a whale watchers paradise. There is a good chance to see minke, humpback, fin, and killer whales while on these safaris.
Travelers can experience the midnight sun in Uummannaq from May 17th to July 28th.

The museum features an exhibition of copies of the costumes and mummies from the Qilakitsoq mummies found nearby. The museum is housed in what used to be the town hospital, dating back to 1880. The museum also features exhibitions from Alfred Wegenerâ€™s expedition of the area.
First discovered in 1972 near the old winter settlement
, these mummies date from 1475. The mummies are on exhibition at the Greenland National Museum in
. It is still possible to visit the site where they were found.

value: address=Alfred Berthelsenip Aqq. B-9, P.O. Box 26, 3961 Uummannaq, Greenland
content=Small museum in town containing historical artifacts and traditional Inuit art.

The best time to take a dog sledding adventure is from February to April, during this time, the fjord that surrounds Uummannaq is frozen and the dog sled is the main method of transport between the town and the settlements.
Heliskiing near Uummannaq is unbelievable. The best place to go is the Sernersuaq glacier on the large peninsula

Ice fishing is a great way to get out on the frozen fjord in the winter and spend some time with the locals. The local fishermen travel out to the fishing sites on the fjord in the winter by dog sled to fish for halibut.
Skiing is part of everyday life in Uummannaq, especially on the ice fjords. It serves as a method of transport and a great way to see the local scenery.
Snowmobiling is a great way for tourist to travel between the settlements at Uummannaq. The easiest way to rent one is to check with the local tourist office in Uummannaq.
